review: I don't know why I'm writing a review for Fridays. Its pretty much the same as every american food chain restaurant as far as food quality & experience. BUT this one in particular i feel like sharing my experience. I like that they have a rewards program. So i decided to use my points towards a coupon for a free entree. The coupon had so many exclusions it was ridiculous , but i  read the fine print & everything and found a meal compatible. Our waiter was excellent, and didnt seem bothered we were using a coupon but said he'd have to get a manager to redeem the coupon. This Asian Manager Lady came over & said that my meal was excluded from the list & i told her i read everything on the coupon , all the fine print & this meal was most certainly not excluded. I started to get the coupon out and show her  , but she stopped me and said "whatever. if you THINK it is...ill just do it."  and went off. completely rude, i couldnt believe she was a manager. Anyways, we didnt hold this against the waiter and tipped him good. But i decided Id never go to this location again. Previous experiences were not so bad, but not good either. Food tastes like its prepackaged/ frozen.  Some people have told me it actually is frozen food. So I dont go to these places anymore.

We came on a Friday night around 6:30 pm. It wasn't busy and we were seated immediately. At first they tried to seat us at this small two-person table (which, okay, I get it...it was just two of us, but still...) near a large group celebrating a birthday. We asked to move and they had no problem accommodating our request. Our waiter was friendly and efficient. They gave us free chips and salsa, but this might be standard now for all TGIFriday's. Either way, it was nice to have something to munch on. Our food was cooked perfectly and service was fast. I ordered the Jack Daniels burger and man was it delicious! Of course anything with Jack Daniels sauce is going to be amazing (in my opinion). It comes with bacon and cheese and normal burger toppings (lettuce, tomato, onion, mayo). My boyfriend ordered the sampler with mozzarella sticks, boneless wings, and fried green beans. I know they have been on the menu forever, but I had never tried fried green beans before and they weren't bad. I miss their fried mac-n-cheese though. Overall, standard chain restaurant experience.

Typical chain restaurant.  Nothing too special, but when I crave their green bean fries... I crave it *bad* lol  I guess there's just something about 'em that I love.  Maybe it's the cucumber wasabi ranch dip. I didn't know that happy hour is at the bar only and our hostess never mentioned it to us.  I was really disappointed I was missing out on the half priced appetizers. The burgers are mediocre, but the fries are seasoned well.  I usually order the dragonfire chicken for my entree.  It's tasty & it's less than 750 calories.  Service & atmosphere is a-ok.

I craved TGIFriday's brownie obsession while on my lunch break. I placed the order to go.  Once I returned back to my place of employment I opened the container to find the brownie frozen solid!  I contacted the manager who insisted that the brownies ordered to go are not heated so that it does not melt the ice cream.  This explanation may have been acceptable if the brownie and the ice cream were packaged in the same container.  The manager went on to apologize for the waitress not informing me that the brownie would not be served warm.  He also offered to mail me a free appetizer/dessert coupon.   Nice gesture for a craving gone wrong.

Poor service We were visiting from out of town and the tgi friday's  by lynhaven  was the worst. Hostess was rude, waiter was rude.Bottom line: we left 10 mins after we arrived! Wouldnt recomend to anyone!Ever!

Im never thoroughly impressed with this place but I think today was the icing on the cake. First off woo hoo for happy hour but dont let the price fool you the drinks are half the size. I ordered a bud light which came flat. When the bartender came back over I said im sorry I dont want to be annoying and he immediately says dont worry you already are....I said the beer is flat. His response is its been down all day, well common sense to me why would you sell it. The tostado appetizer was sub par. Upon ordering my entree our bartender was snappy. Its evident this man didnt like his job. Well get a new one. Im a server too and no matter what always tip but seriously dude if im irritating you go home and don't be mad when you hopefully read this and decide you need to re evaluate your attitude. BTW fellow yelpers his name is Scott H.

i use to LOVE Friday's. back when i was a teenager and would get dropped off at the mall- this place made me feel way more adult and i ate it up. literally.  the problem is- i eat differently now. all the fried food and pastas with a trillion ingredients and heavy meat dishes don't appeal to me anymore. i'm more about quality over quantity, so Friday's just doesn't fit the bill any longer. the service was very nice. i went on a friday afternoon and it was dead. my food came fast and was fine. i ordered a beer and quickly finished my burger and left. meh. nothing to cheer for.  the parking situation does seem a little odd and i think the restaurant itself is really poorly placed. i would never go to this location on a weekend. some Friday's across the country are placed in trendier areas with ample parking and the bar is known to be a great place to meet people....as in.... a meat market. i think this location seems more like a mommies to lunch stop.

We had a good dinner. Been going here for years and haven't been disappointed yet. Chris, our waiter, did a fine job catering to our needs. I look forward to eating here again soon. Next time I hope to save room for dessert.

Two weekends ago, my family and I visited Virginia Beach for some R & R. During our stay at the beach, we went to this TGI Fridays location. TGI Fridays is known for serving good food and being a cut above other sports bars such as Applebees. How was my experience? Here goes the review.  The Good.  Convenience- Anyone who is from or has traveled near Lynnhaven Mall knows that it is a magnet for traffic. Doesnt matter what time of the day you travel in the area, if the mall isnt packed then the nearby restaurants are packed. Well this Fridays was not packed during the time of my evening visit. My family was able to walk inside with no wait time.  The Bad: Service- The host and server did not appear to be very friendly towards my party. We were treated with basic respect, but there was no hospitality shown from the two employees. Aside from that, the wait time for the food exceeded thirty minutes. There was a party that sat down beside my table about 15-20 minutes after we arrived but received their entrees about 5 minutes after we did. When we finally received our food, it was pretty luke warm. Because we were hungry and did not want to wait another 30+ minutes for a changed order or battle through the traffic to go to another restaurant where the wait would have been even longer, we did not ask for a refund.  Overall- Service, service, service. That is what will make or break my experience at a resturant. The service was seriously lacking and was inexcusable. There is no reason why the food should have taken so long to come out. I could understand if the restaurant was filled to capacity, but it was barely 25% filled during my visit. For that reason, I do not have any plans to come back to this particular TGI Fridays. ONE STAR.
Didn't even get served. Got up and left. Place was empty. Heard pins dropping.

I like Friday's. Out of all of the locations in the Tidewater area, I like this one the best and after that the one in Oyster Point. To be a chain restaurant, I do enjoy the food. My favorites are the triple jack combo and the sizzling chicken/sizzling chicken and shrimp. Love their loaded mashed potatoes. I enjoy their ribs - keep in mind that this is not a dedicated RIB restaurant - but the ribs are pretty good. Let me be the first to tell you that anything that is drenched in Jack Daniels BBQ Sauce is freaking AMAZING. For those who like to indulge from time to time in spirits, they have an extensive drink menu which I love (don't judge me)  The only complaint that I have with this location is that they are SLOWWWWWWWWWWW. I don't care what you order, where you sit, who your waiter/waitress is, what time of day it is, what season - the service is soooooooo slow. Even going there upon opening at 11AM and less than 10 customers they are so slow. Only come here when you have ample time. I have been late back to work because of Fridays so many times it's ridiculous!  I'll be back when I have time to spare!

I don't have high expectations for chain restaurants but this place was below average.  The hostest was awesome,  greeting us with a smile and even pulled out my chair.  She was super sweet and we tipped her. Service was awful the manager was our waiter and he provided the worse service EVER. He tried to apologize but I'm like it's a Friday night and we are at TGIFriday's for goodness sake!  Apology NOT accepted. You should be prepared to handle a normal dinner rush.  I honestly have nothing good to say about this place. The food was mediocre at best and the drinks sat for so long they were watered down and since we had no service we had no refills. Skip this location.

My recent visit was ok. I walked in waited a little bit for the waitress to greet me. He ask if I wanted a appetizer and took my drink order. Waited a good 5 minutes just to get a strawberry crush lemonade. Told him I wanted the sizzling chicken and shrimp. The food came to my table about 10-15 mins later. The waitress didn't check on me but one time. Probably should have went somewhere else.

Have been here over the years, and I give them a rating overall of about 3.5 stars.   It is Fridays after all, so it is quite predictable.  You know what you are going to get when you visit Fridays. :-)   The stand out Positives:  The waiters and waitresses have been consistently great at this location in recent visits.  Specific Visit:    Yesterday I stopped in with my 2 teen sons and 5 of their friends, total 8 people dining.  The new "Endless Appetizers" option is awesome, as 5 of the 8 kids got 5 different appetizers as their choice, then shared, so all folks worked on those endless eats. :-)    Total bill was about 108.00 for 8 peoples' eats and drinks, what is that, about $12 a person?  A good deal for this fun outing.    --- And I tell you what, the waiter was so good and friendly with this table full of teens that I did what I only do once or twice per year:   left him a $100.00 bill cash tip.  Wait service was 5-star on this occasion!

A friend had a gift card for Friday's, so we headed off for dinner tonight.  I haven't stepped foot in this chain in at least five years, so I wasn't sure what to expect.  What I ended up primarily experiencing was sticker shock.  I generally frequent restaurants in the Ghent area of Norfolk and like to support local places, which I had just assumed were a little pricier than your standard chain.  Come to find out, they're really not.  After reading over the menu, seeing the food coming out, and knowing it was a chain, I just couldn't justify spending over ten bucks for a burger.  I ended up ordering a bowl of soup.  My friend ordered the flat iron steak. My broccoli cheese soup was thick.  Like, thicker than cheese dip thick.  My guess is they either didn't mix it proportionately with liquid or else it had been sitting for awhile and condensed itself.  It was salty but edible.  It came with one pack of stale saltine crackers that lacked any kind of crispiness.  My friend fared much better with her steak; she said her meal was very good and she would order it again. Service was adequate.  Our drinks were refilled as needed and the check brought in a timely manner.  I debated about giving a 3-star review, but my soup was honestly two-star.  So steer clear of the soup and maybe it will be okay.  I just know now I'm really even more excited to eat at local restaurants!

Normally I don't rate chain restaurants but I'll make an exception today.  The service was good, although the waitress tried to correct my pronunciation of bruschetta (I've been living in Italy the last four years... I think I might know this better than you.)  I do have one major complaint with the food. The ribs were too tender. The meat was sliding off the bones, and I actually had to use a fork to eat my ribs. A fork!   I will be coming back to sample the desserts, and maybe more of the delicious fried shrimp.

We get there at 5:00pm on a Saturday. From outside, aw man, such delicious smells were filling the air. We got pumped! We were also starving! So we walk in, no one there to greet us. We waited for about 2-3 mins. Which I could see the hostess and what looked like a manager prepping a table. I know they saw us cause we all made eye contact when we walked in the door. There were a lot of table vacant so I did not understand why it took 2 people to prep at 4 person table. Anyways, so then a waitress walks over to us in like slow motion . I'm instantly irritated. We sat down, she took our drink orders and said she'll be back with chips and salsa, I don't like to complain about anything complimentary because that's free food and a nice gesture. But shoot, the chips were just  awful. Kinda tasted burnt and hard. Salsa tasted like it was scooped out from the jar. We ordered the pick 5 appetizers for $22. We got ahi tuna crisps, fried bacon Mac n cheese, Reuben's, and Hachi steak kabobs. Tuna crisps? Bland (guacamole threw off the whole dish), fried bacon Mac n cheese? Gross, Reuben's? Ok, habach skewers? Fucken awesome . So for $22 plus tax and tip was about 30. We spent $30 only to like 2 small skewers of meat. Will I be back? Heck to the no.

Last night I went to Fridays and had dinner with my husband and son.. it was a last minute stop..we had  the sizzling chicken and shrimp our server was freddie he was very nice and got every detail to our order correct ... he suggested a few things that I may like so I tried them and they were great I love how they change the recipe for the shrimp !!!!      Shiney

My wife and I came to have a beer and apps service was was great other than being a bit slow sat at the bar food took a long time and was mediocre beer was cold and in a clean glass overall good place to eat. Amber was a good bartender thank you for everything

Wolfman come to this establishment for feast. The first time Wolfman come, the waitress gave Wolfman a menu but never came back. Wolfman took the ketchup and sprayed it into the menu and left. The second time, Wolfman gave TGI Fridays another chance. TGI Fridays is Wolfman's favorite establishment for eatery back when Wolfman was a pup-man.  The hostess sat Wolfman at a bar in hopes that Wolfman would not be forgotten and lost. Wolfman dat and waited for someone to help Wolfman but nobody came until Wolfman howled at somebody for feast. Wolfman ordered food and in twenty minutes, Wolfman got Wolfman's food. They got Wolfman's steak wrong because Wolfman was too clear about what Wolfman wanted. Wolfman explained carefully and clearly in the native language of human Americans which resulted in the downfall of Wolfman's expected dinner. Wolfman no like this establishment. Wolfman hate establishment. Wolfman BOOOO establishment. 1 star from Wolfman.

We placed an order via phone, picked it up and took it home.   Upon opening our 5 boxes each cheeseburger was charcoal black and dry.  The french fries were ok if you like alot of salt.  The food was poorly prepared so I took the meals back.  After speaking with the manager he agreed to fix the problem and apologized.  ONE HOUR later I have our food and headed home.
The waitress was great. The food? Well, not so much... Other locations have been great and we love Fridays, but this one just wasn't to our liking or was just having an off day.

Sat at the bar tonight, being a Saturday they were pretty busy. Our bartenders were very kind and attentive. I ordered a Captain and diet coke- it was strong but good! My boyfriend had the NY bacon burger- he said it was the best burger he's had in a while (he's very picky). I'm eating low carb so I had the chicken and cheese skillet with broccoli. It was phenomenal. The cheese was so stringy and creamy- the peppers intermingled were delicious and so was the chicken. I'm weary about "garlic" marinades but this was very well done. Also: This was our first visit to this location. I'd definitely go back.

Just...yuck. Food served barely lukewarm, TWICE. No utensils. Food was prepped wrong. None of the condiments we requested came to the table. Atmosphere was dark. Waitress was terrible. Worst Friday's experience I've had. Pass on this place.

Wonderful service, great food!  The Jack Daniels sauce is superb.   I had the Jack Daniel's burger with fries and a Bleu cheese wedge.  The salad was one of the best I've had in a while.  I loved it.  Will be going back.  Good job.

My hubby and I came here a week ago, was a weekday night and beautiful out. Our waitress sucked, and I'm not one to judge because I'm a 4 year experienced waitress. The place was not busy and I'm a tgi Fridays member, we asked for a second round of chips and salsa, she never got them out to us and then said they would be out when we already had our check! so we told her to forget it. Then she took about 25 minutes to get the check back to us. If you can't handle being in a quick pace job, don't waitress. This was the first time we went to a tgi Fridays in va beach being we are from PA and didn't even know there was one down here. I will make sure to stick to my PA tgi Fridays next time I go home to visit family!

Came here after work with my boyfriend last Thursday. We arrived around 9pm and were sat in an empty lower section, that was ok. Our waitress was alright, simple and nice, refilled drinks regularly. My boyfriend and I spent forever deciding what to order because there really wasn't that big of a selection. When I think T.G.I.Fridays I think cheap food, because the commercials look cheap. Nope. Everything was expensive. They advertised in the menu that they made their own buns for the burgers but when I got my burger the bun was hard :( and the fries were hard and hollow inside. We had a coupon for a free desert but by the end of the meal I just wanted to leave, so we did. Oh well.

Everything about this place was a little off. They gave is a bad table when there was pleanty of seating. I think they were trying to stick all the kids in one corner. The table itself was not the cleanest. Appitizer had some burnt parts in the dip. The JD chicken which we've had multiple times at other Fridays was so over seasoned it fried my tounge. We asked to just get the chicken replaced to go and waited 20 mins with nothing to eat before they got it fixed. Waiter was nice. And they solved the problem. But I don't eat out to have problems. And it all just added you in the end to two stars and us planning to not come back.

I did it again, but this time it wasn't so bad. Mom and I went to TGIF for some post-shopping nourishment. Trying on clothes and shoes really gives you an appetite. I think our waitress's name was Courtney... I can't remember, but she was nice. She was always checking on us and refilling drinks. She was even seating people. They sure kept her busy! We got the Three-For-All app. You get a choice of either boneless or traditional wings and two other apps. This one had mozzarella sticks, pretzels with beer cheese, pot stickers, potato skins, fried green beans, and something else... We decided on ghost pepper traditional wings, pot stickers, and potato skins. Mom wasn't too thrilled with the app. She said the potato skins were too greasy, the wings too spicy, and she wouldn't even look at the pot stickers. I thought the potato skins were okay and the wings weren't spicy enough. The pot stickers were another story. You can definitely tell they were previously frozen. The wrapper had a dry, yet damp, texture and the filling was really chewy. I ate it, of course. The flavours were all there. For our main meal, mom ordered the shrimp and ribs and I got the 6 oz. sirloin with tomato mozzarella salad and spinach. Mom picked off all the breading on her shrimp because it was too greasy, but she ate everything. She really enjoyed the ribs. My steak was good (I ordered it medium and got it rare - sent to back and it was perfect) and so was the salad, but the spinach was suuuuuuper salty. I got halfway through and called it quits. I could feel my feet swelling up. lol Dessert was the Tennessee whiskey cake. I loved it and I usually don't care for dessert. The whiskey sauce was good and the cake had a good consistency. Even my mother, who's a picky eater, had a few bites. Our bill came to $68. My mom still doesn't believe her meal was $25, but it was. We left with full, happy bellies. Hell, I might even start going to Fridays if it gets better!
Food was ok kinda stale sauce was ok the overall experience was ok.  Would I go back?  No just go somewhere else no point in trying it again
12.00 all you can eat apps love the street tacos and the JD steak.. Service is great also

WOW! We had a large party of 12 people, and Mike & Freddie took really good care of us!  Their teamwork was awesome. All the food was perfectly cooked and our drinks stayed full. We are coming back again! They put put TGIF back on the map for us!

I fell for it again. Seems I got sucked in. When u see their commercials or ur friends want to come here to eat u think oh it won't be that bad. Almost every single time u give in & go tho it is pretty bad. Food is ehhh but service is great.

The bar area smells old and nasty. Bar stools don't have backs to them which is uncomfortable. I ordered the Seasonal Harvest Apple Chicken Salad with no apricots and no rice noodles.  However it came out missing the kale, apples, and goat cheese. Part of the mistake was because the bartender didn't write down my order and entered it in wrong and part was because the kitchen messed up as well. The kitchen manager did come out and apologize and give me a free appetizer coupon, which was nice. But I was irritated because I didn't have a lot of time and was only trying to grab a quick lunch and this delayed me quite a bit. Probably won't be back.

More of a 2.50, not quite a 3. It's your usual TGIF chain - dark wood all around, and red & white striped tables (I once made the mistake of wearing a red & white striped tank top which matched the table exactly.) Yikes! The bar here is excellent, I've never had a problem with any drinks, from their yummy teas to their alcoholic beverages. Food-wise, I want to say that the only thing they really have going is their appetizers. Every entree l I've had here has just been "ok."  The last meal I had here recently was the "PARMESAN-CRUSTED CHICKEN" - no bueno. It was grilled chicken drenched in italian dressing, topped with some crumbs and cheese. Didn't even eat a fourth of it, but continued to eat from my bf's "endless" appetizers. I love, love, love their green bean fries, gyoza, & potato skins. I'd definitely come here for apps & drinks, that's it. :)

Came here last Saturday while in town to visit friends and family.  I will say the service was awesome.  Our waitress was very knowledgeable and the meal was delicious.  Would definitely come back next time I'm in town.
Horrible customer services,food was cold they took forever to get my changes back. They still have the gut to asked me if I was waiting my change.

I will give this place one star for the food always being amazing but I have have been double charged here more than once and all they ever do is only fix it , they don't even go as far as to offer you a percentage off of your bill or a gift card , how can they double charge you and think it's ok .. What if this would cause me to overdraw my account or what if I needed the money for something else . I went there last night and my bill was 72.01 , they charged me 72.01 and my mom 72.01 and then charged her 28.00 for what she ordered . I am so sick of this place and will not be back !

Ok to start my roommate and I had Taylor waiting on us(she was aweso E) We both ordered the jack Daniels burger. My roommate and I are both allergic to tomatoes, so we asked for no tomatoes and I asked for jalapeños on the burger another serving on the side. My roommate asked for honey mustard. Well long story short the kitchen staff SUCKED. there was tomatoes on both burgers remember we were both allergic to tomatoes. I received no jalapeños on my burger they just messed it all kinds of the server Taylor was very apologetic and she was actually quite awesome. The kitchen staff got absolutely nothing right and when they did come back out to forgot and or left they were unpleasant borderline rude. This was my first visit to this restaurant end it did not leave a very good impression. This was my roommates third visit and in her words she will not be returning!  In closing I only gave three stars because of how good the waitress Was I would give 0-1/2 of a star for the kitchen staff!

Today I sat at the bar! When I sat down it was clean, busy but clean. Kristin assist me first, it was awkward because I walked in with another couple and I felt as if the bartenders didn't help me right away bc I looked like I was the party of 3 and the other 2 already ordered.  It worked itself out and I got my Diet Pepsi. As I worked myself through the endless app menu (wow that sounded like such a large behind thing to say) I was greeted by Kevin who was working server bartender (he was helping the bartender) let me give him kudos. He may not have had to have conversations with me but he did. He was VERY POLITE AND PROFESSIONAL. Steve is funny, he's professional and he gets the job done, honestly can't ask for more. Kristin appeared to work circles around him however to each I own. Kristin, Tonight she was an employees dream. She anticipated some of my orders. She worked her butt off, she will sleep well tonight. Kristin joked, worked and never let her smile slip. There was one more bartender who I don't know his name. He's a handsome without a smile. The one thing I noticed from him was he took a credit card from a patron and put it on his pocket?! Maybe TGIF finds that okay but it looked suspicious. I say that bc Kristin kept the cash and cc out in the open. I almost forgot Adam. I noticed him in his reddish shirt and he appeared "important". I never called him over yet he came to talk to Me which I thought was great. He mentioned the items i ordered, he asked how my experience has been and we had a very professional chat. I do t agree with the 3 stars, I know more people will review the good side of this restaurant!!!

Met a business contact here late in the evening, after checking in at my hotel. I don't really like chain restaurants, except for cheap drinks and late night appetizers. T.G.I.Friday's still does their endless appetizers, so I went for it. BBQ beef tostadas and various boneless wings filled me up quickly. My waitress was friendly and quick to take orders and keep drinks filled. Not my first choice of place to eat, but it works.

They always have good food here. I love their bruschetta chicken pasta, the ribs, cheeseburgers, steak, and chicken dishes. They also have good appetizers too. I love their vanilla bean cheesecake and also their Oreo Madness dessert. It does take a while for the food to come out sometimes, but overall it's a great place with a great atmosphere.

Stopped for lunch on a long trip through VA. Bathroom was unclean, which should have sent me packing, but I said I'd give it a try. Service was fast & friendly, but my roast beef sandwich was missing something...the taste of beef. Fries and salad were fine, but the sandwich was "blah." That and 2 drinks set me back $28. Meh.

Today I went to TGI Fridays and had a fantastic experience! There was not many people there, so it was a quiet and decently fast experience. The food was great, but my favorite part was the loaded mashed potatoes! They are delicious! My meal altogether was wonderful, but the highlight would definitely be the potatoes. We were sat next to the kitchen and the staff was a bit loud, but nothing too bad. That's my only complaint, I highly recommend this establishment!

We have excellent bar tenders and servers here! Managers set high expectations for us, and we like to deliver a great product. We always have some kind of special or happy hour going on, so bring your friends and family and come on out! Kids eat free Tuesday's from 5-9 and the bar top has happy hour apps everyday!

The best late night to go on a Sunday for great food for cheap. Hardly no one here (except the lingering drinkers). Which takes me to the awesome specials they always have. $4 drinks, pick five apps, not to mention the happy hour. And even with the emptiness, the service is still awesome. Love TGIF!

I've had better service at this store in the past. Last night not so much. Server left the plates on the table and never picked them up. Didn't refill drinks. Was very slow getting us the check. We waited over 20 minutes and had to flag him down to ask for the check. He seemed confused, and then told us it was his last night. Very rude. The burger I had was burned and obviously overcooked. Dry, but I ate it anyway instead of sending it back. At least the fries were excellent and served without salt like I asked. If last night was my first visit, I wouldn't go back. I've been to this store several times over the last couple of decades, and this was the worst visit. All the other visits were good service and the food was great. I'll let this one pass, since the server is probably gone now.

We came to celebrate a friends children's birthday; and luckily it was kids day-- so the kids ate for free. That's why this place gets 2 stars. That was the only good part about our visit. They had a special for $14.99 and it was a "sirloin and lobster tail." We asked about the special and the waitress didn't know what it was-- but it was 5:50 and the deal ended at 6:00. She had to go get someone else to explain the special to us. The meat was a ribeye. Not a sirloin. Which would have been fine if it wasn't so fatty that I couldn't even cut through it. I was able to salvage about 2 bites from the entire steak. She also told us it came with 2 lobster tails and 2 sides. The "lobster tails" were actually one small lobster tail cut in half that wasn't even cooked all the way. (And she also forgot to mention that even though it came with 2 sides there would be an up-charge for them both.) I told her about the quality of my steak, and she told me she would tell the kitchen. I ordered the Oreo cookie ice cream dessert-- which was great; until I found a piece of a plastic bag in the middle of my ice cream. She apologized and took the dessert off of my check, but she never had a manager stop by the table, and still charged me for the steak that I only had 2 bites of (since the meat wasn't even edible.) Also- when we got our check, the special was charged as $19.99 instead of $14.99 and she tried telling us it was because of the up-charge for the sides. $5 for 2 sides that supposedly came with the entree didn't seem right. She then admitted to hitting the wrong specials button charging us more and fixed our checks. We were in the restaurant for about 2 1/2 hours because the service was ridiculously  slow. Save yourself the hassle and don't even bother wasting your time coming here- we wasted hours of our night to still leave hungry.

We attempted to eat there on a Sunday afternoon. It wasn't crowded, but we were told that it would be a 10 to 15 minute wait. We said okay and had a seat. After 30 minutes I went inside to inquire about the status of our table. At that point a manager stated that they we working on our table at that moment. The problem was that the manager didn't even look at the computer or talk to anyone to make this determination.  After another 10 minutes we decided to leave. This was my first and last attempt at trying to eat at this Friday's. If it was taking that long to get a table, I can only imagine how long it would have taken to receive our food.

We use to really like this place.  Had not been in months and decided to go last nigbt....mistake!  We were at out table a sitting down within 10 mins of arrival...not to bad considering its Saturday at 7 pm...drink order taken within a few mins...out drinks arrive after about 5 mins  waiter takes our order and disappears after asking me what dressing i want on my ceasar salads, wow really!  he reappears after about 15 mins and ask if we want more to drink  We said yes and he states our food is coming in a couple of mins.  about 15 mins later our new drinks and food finally arrive.  food was warm not hot and just not their normal from several months ago  we were finished in abiut 10 mins but could see our waiter anywhere so we waited and waited and waited  finally he appears and thankfully we had a ten dollar coupon because our meal wasnt even worth what we paid after the coupon  waiters comes back after diappearing again takes our credit card final and return rather quickly this time.  Now today i wake up to a migrane and swelling cause from MSG...just great  As im sure this is a company wide change in your food I wont be back
Out of cider..out of sweet tea vodka...sweet tea was bad...loaded potatoes were fried..:yuk..hamburgers thrown together.  Service really bad and there was hardly anyone there.

This location has to be one of the worst Friday's ever. I live less than 5 minutes from this location and EVERY visit it gets worse and worse I will definitely not be returning.I ordered the Jack Daniels sliders one of my favorite menu items and I stated that I wanted them well done when I ordered them because previously in the past they were still pink on the inside. When the sliders arrived I begin to eat them after a few bites I noticed how rare the center of them were raw and red this is just ridiculous someone is going to get sick from this establishment. The management seems poorly trained the server seemed more concerned than the manager. This location is a total insult to Friday's chain this is one of my favorite restaurants to eat at but I will never eat here again after this incident I can't take the chance of getting E. coli Listeria or even Salmonella.

The food: Mediocre, at best. The service was very good. The endless appetizers are quite disappointing. The all taste like reheated cafeteria-quality snacks. The pot stickers are the best - they do heat them well enough, and the dipping sauce is good. I could get the same at Number One Chinese, and have the choice of steamed or fried. The burgers my wife and I ordered were okay. Better than a McDonald's fried burger. The BBQ sauces were weak, and the bacon barely had any flavor. The tea and ice water was very good. A handful of employees set up a few tables for a large group, but rather than picking up the chairs and tables, they dragged them around on the tile flooring. A bit too noisy for dinner time. A bit disruptive. We have eaten here three times in the past two months to give them a chance. We will eat elsewhere.
About as good as you can expect from a TGI Friday's. Prices were pretty expensive for what you got. However my waitress and the service was fantastic!

The foods decent but this particular Fridays is always freezing (even during winter) and always seem to forget to upload your points when you leave your number on the receipt. It's like they only open the checkbook to see if they have a tip and that's it. Also, The tables always look dirty and quite a few times I've been given plates and utensils with stains on them.

Very disappointed! Google and your website said you would be open until 02 and when and they were close at midnight. Very disappointing considering I work late and this was one of the few places that were open.

Overpriced, but fun choice that serves fun drinks (alcohol) and has super nice staff.   I go to TGI Fridays about once a month.  I always leave reasonably happy so they are doing something right (for me, anyway).  I've read the other reviews and can see many of their points - lol. Ultimately, its a fun atmosphere where you will be overcharged... lol.  I like it and will still go back. :-)

So we went for my sisters high school graduation dinner. Coming in the people weren't to friendly, but it didn't bother us so much. Our waitress was so nice and friendly so made up for coming in. Appetizer was good just did buffalo wings, and had our salads come in with that. But man once that entree came out. Delicious, that's Jack Daniels chicken and bbq sauce wish we could of bought a bottle. Other issue was the quesadillas definitely lacked any flavor or seasons. It was mostly cheese than chicken. Only major issue, but everything else was good
The only good thing about this restaurant was our server, Neil, everything else was garbage including the dead fly that was on the plate when we got there.

Came here for a company lunch with about 9 of my co-workers. We were seated immediately in a nice, roomy corner. Our waitress was really, really sweet and attentive. Haven't been to Friday's in 2 years but the menu has hardly changed...still typical Americana bar food. I've been to much filthier places, but everything here looks old and like it'd be sticky if you touched it.  After waiting between 30-45 minutes for our meals--even after our waitress said she advised the kitchen that we were on lunch so our food would come out asap--my broccoli and mashed potatoes are ok, but the "tender" ribeye that I ordered medium was nearly well done and tough enough to get into the Salty Spitoon.  Might be back for drinks and apps though since they start at $5 and they're doing the bottomless thing.

This TGI Friday's is located on Lynnhaven Parkway, not too far from Lynnhaven Mall.  The exterior of the place is easy to find when you drive by.  It will be on the right if heading north on Lynnhaven Pkwy to get to the place.  Their parking lot is small in the front and is in desperate need of a re-paving.  Also, the parking spots there are pretty thin.  I saw pickup trucks and bigger vehicles parked there that took up two parking spaces. What brought me in here?  I actually got a coupon to use in the mail.  Since it had been a little over three years since I visited the place, I figured it was a good time to try it out again.  The coupon was for a buy one get one entree with two drink purchases.  The coupon was good during the month of July.  I am bummed though that they reset the stripes points, as I had racked up 479 points after my last visit before this one.  I'd come back more often if I can get those points re-added to my account so that I can use them. Once you come inside, the bar is pretty much in front of you, along with other dining areas.  One thing you'll notice as soon as you come in is how dark the place is.  I don't like it too dark, so the request was to sit at a table near a window and that request was granted. Once seated, it took a few minutes for our server to come to the table.  It wasn't too busy in there at the time, but she had some tables all over the place, not just in one area.  I think they would be better off doing it in sections instead.  Anyways, once she came to the table, she was very attentive and answered all of the questions we had for her about the menu, substitutions, and food allergies.  No appetizers were ordered on this visit. For my choice of entree, I selected the Jack Daniels Chicken Sandwich.  I asked to have the Jack Daniels sauce on the side so that I could do some portion control, which they did for me.  Overall, the sandwich was good and was fresh.  I would say that it is similar to other chain burger/bar type places that are out there.  The fries were good as well, but it seems like you don't get as much here when it comes to that.  It looks bigger in the way that it is displayed.  Also, I ended up dusting off some of the salt on it as I try to do things lightly salted (a photo of the entree is included). Once everything was done, it was time for the check.  The coupon was applied to the purchase.  I gave my server a bit of a surprise, as I had already paid the check before she came back.  How did that happen?  There is bar code at the bottom of the receipt, and you can pay directly through the Friday's mobile app.  She didn't even know that was an option and we were the first customers of hers to use it.  I showed her how I did it and she liked that. Overall, I did have a good experience here.  It wouldn't necessarily be my first place for burgers, as I like to try many different places, including locally owned non-chain places.  Service was great with no issues.  The food was good.  There wasn't anything that would "wow" me to give a rating above 3 stars.  Cheers!

I love this place, way more than I should. My go to meal is the appetizer sampler. It has shrimp, sesame chicken, and ribs. These are my favorites, along with the wontons and the fried string beans. However, I just had the sampler, because it was already enough food. I couldn't even finish it. I went here during lunch, on a work day. The service is very fast during this time. You can certainly get in and out in 1 hour.  My only wish for TGIF, is for them to update their restaurant. They've had the same decor as long as I can remember. I think it desperately needs and upgrade.

This is the worst restaurant I have ever been to. When I was seated in the booth section I was in almost complete darkness. I had to use my phone flashlight to properly read the menu. The whole place looked dirty and dim - at 2pm. It was pretty empty when I went there and the wait was reasonable BUT THE FOOD IS TERRIBLE. I got the spinach queso and chips. The queso tasted expired, the chips were completely stale and impossible to chew, and the guacamole was dark brown even though all I could taste was lime. My boyfriend got 10 wings and they only gave him 9. Please just don't go

So we came here with a party of 7 to celebrate my fathers birthday at 5pm. we walked and told them how many we had and the hostess said it would be a 45-1 hour long wait?!!....Looked around and it was empty and plenty of 4 top tables that could pushed together to accompany us and when we mentioned this they said they couldn't do that because they didn't offer to do that for the larger party that was waiting ahead. Wait? So because you lack the critical thinking aspects of basic problem solving, we couldn't get a table in an almost empty restaurant.. No thanks. We left to go elsewhere. Will not be returing

I never tried TGIF before. So, i tried the Big Ribs. Those meats just fall off the bone. You don't really need a knife. The sauce is kinda sweet but i use  Tabasco and it tase really good. The Onion Soup was a little salty but goody. It wasn't bad.

this place seems to be falling off. i used to come here a lot back in the day to get a jack daniel's burger, some fried green beans, and some happy hour -- but their service has gone off and the drinks suck! the food was okay, but the service is so horrible that you end up getting your food cold cause it's been sitting there.  we rarely ever see a hostess by the door cause they're playing around with a server in the back.
